Great!! Took me a bit to figure everything out, but eventually got it. On Lion you need to use the  terminal command

sudo open -t /etc/hosts

instead of 


sudo /Applications/TextEdit.app/Contents/MacOS/TextEdit /etc/hosts


AND on top of that you need to unlock the textedit thing that comes up as soon as you do that, or else nothing will be saved.  Tada! Great torrent!

How do I unlock the HOSTS file in Lion? I see the "unlock" stuff when I click "locked", but when I press this, it says: "the file hosts cannot be unlocked - you can duplicate this document and edit the duplicate"...

heres  a way u can modify it through terminal. 

1. open terminal
2. type this sudo nano /private/etc/hosts
3.copy the instruction stuff
4. ctrl+o
5. ctrl+x then press y and then enter
DONE!

Everyone that has upgraded to Lion, Apple have locked the hosts file so using the old Sudo code won't work.

In order to access hosts now open terminal and enter (sudo nano /etc/hosts) Without the brackets of course.

Once you're in paste the text as it says in the instructions, you must use your arrow keys to scroll down and across inside the terminal. Once you have done this press ctrl + x followed by enter. Do not use cmd + S as this will only save the file into your documents.

Enjoy!

Ok guys I have had some trouble getting this to work on lion but this is how I got it working after much trial and error!

1. open terminal
2. type this sudo nano /private/etc/hosts
3. copy the instruction stuff so it looks exactly like the example host file
4. CTRL+O
5. Enter
6. CTRL+X
7. flush as in the instructions
8. then Instead of trying to deactivate, just when it pops up with continue trial or register box just put in the key code provided in the instructions file... the bottom one worked for me!

Peace

if you're having trouble with hosts on os x lion just do this:

1)go on finder -> go to folder
2)type /private and press enter
3)then right click on etc folder
4) unlock permissions with your passwords (by clicking on the little padlock)
5) change everything to read and write
6) then open etc folder and search for hosts file double click it
7)then copy and paste adobe activation blocker between 127.0.0.0 and 255.255.255
8) cmd+s, thats all you're done!

Ok, so if your a complete noob like me here goes

Im running lion which i recently upgraded from snow leopard. 

1. Install Photoshop from the DMG file provided
2. Use the 30 day trial period to get onto Photoshop when its installed
3. Go to the terminal and enter 
    sudo open -e /etc/hosts
4. The terminal will change style, 
5. Open the .txt document provided called (This is how the host file should look.txt)
6. Copy EVERYTHING!!!! into the terminal  
7. then press CTRL > + > X together 
6. A menu will appear at the bottom press Y then enter 
7. In the same terminal enter 
   sudo dscacheutil -flushcache
8. The mac will ask for your password, enter it then hit enter
9. Close the terminal and re-open Photoshop
10. Enter one go these serial numbers
1325-0621-9125-0765-3648-0614                                                   
 #                                                                               
 1325-0365-5929-6118-8817-8422                                                   
 #                                                                               
 1325-0150-1163-7532-1626-3430                                                   
 #                                                                               
 1325-0178-1927-9019-0123-2254                                                   
 #                                                                              
 1325-0702-3693-1544-9166-3515                                                   
 #                                                                               
 1325-0549-2240-0071-3409-1342  
The bottom one worked for me 

11. After finding the correct one, Photoshop will load 
12. Go to help at the top, the select Deactivate (i had to close then re-open photoshop for this to work) 
13. Click permanently deactivate 

Taa-Daaa

@ jonmaxx 
The deactivation feature is for people who run two (or maybe more) copies of Photoshop on LAN on different computers. To use Photoshop on the second computer you need to deactivate it on the first one. Not sure that's exactly how it is but that's the idea. I keep it activated and use it on one Mac. IMO the 'activation/deactivation has nothing to do with successfully cracking. 
And those who have not entered serial yet have the choice to deactivate greyed out, it only becomes active choice once you enter good serial # 
(but then as I said you can leave it activated if you don't plan to run another copy of the program on another computer at home. In fact to run this copy I think it has to be activated or maybe it activates automatically once you start the program - provided good serial was entered originally.)

BTW I would just ignore this thing about malware, I don't know about anything and have it installed since this spring.

10.7.2 users: 

Download a free program called 'Little Snitch'. Don't worry about the hosts file, you won't need to change it in the way noted in the torrent. Install as normal, when prompted for a serial during installation click 'trial version'. Once installed (make sure little snitch is running too), run the program - it will immediately prompt you for another serial. enter one of these:

1325-0150-1163-7532-1626-3430
1325-0178-1927-9019-0123-2254
1325-0702-3693-1544-9166-3515
1325-0549-2240-0071-3409-1342

Little Snitch will then report that the software is trying to access adobe's activation servers. click 'forever' and 'deny'. Enjoy.

(ps. For anyone interested, this seems to work with all adobe products I have tried so far including Dreamweaver...)

If you're getting errors at step 4 read this http://www.tech-recipes.com/rx/2754/os_x_edit_file_using_textedit_as_root_superuser/

Basically what you want to enter is 

sudo open -t /etc/hosts/ /Applications/TextEdit.app/Contents/MacOS/TextEdit /etc/hosts


If you have trouble at step 5 in text edit (which is where this didn't work when my friend tried it) 
go to the torrent download > hosts folder > open the document that says 'this is how the host file should look' 
I copied the text in that instructions file and put it into my mac's text edit document (easiest way to make sure there isn't any error on your part when editing the text) 

after this all the steps worked. Before doing this I DID NOT get the option to decative, I didn't even get it blocked out - it just wasnt there. Some of you tried entering a serial - maybe so that you could actually be active as to deactive. I thought this anyway and I tried it because I wasn't understanding why it wasn't working. 

Anyway do what I suggested for step 5 and you will be able to deactive. after that all the steps work just fine. If some of the serials provided in instructions don't work don't worry - any working serial will do. 

Hope this helps for anyone that's having trouble. I could be wrong, but as I said, it works for me now. I opened and closed the program a few times to make sure I wouldn't be asked for a serial again and it's fine. 

You will need an Adobe ID to enter after deactivating - do this. A thank you screen from adobe will come up. Basically you now have the software, Adobe thinks it's registered. There really should be no more problems. If I get any more problems I'll try solving them and post anything useful. But I think this should be it. This is my first time using a Photoshop torrent so there was a bit of confusion but it's ended well. 

Thanks Cyberpiraten!
